content:
Diagnosis:	Malignant pleural mesothelioma (epithelioid type)

Staging:	T4N0M0 with bilateral pleural disease
	Diagnosed March 2024
	Biomarkers: MTAP loss, PD-L1 TPS 80%

Current Situation:	Initial oncology assessment

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his recent diagnosis of malignant pleural mesothelioma. He initially presented in January 2024 with progressive breathlessness and right-sided chest pain. Initial chest x-ray showed a large right pleural effusion, and subsequent CT thorax demonstrated irregular pleural thickening with nodularity affecting both pleural surfaces, more extensive on the right. Video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS) and pleural biopsy on 15/03/24 confirmed epithelioid mesothelioma.

He reports worsening breathlessness over the past 2 weeks, now occurring with minimal exertion (ECOG PS 2). He has ongoing right-sided chest pain requiring regular opioid analgesia, and his weight has dropped by 6kg over 3 months. Night sweats are becoming more frequent.

CT staging completed on 25/03/24 shows extensive bilateral pleural disease with mediastinal involvement and early chest wall invasion on the right (T4N0M0). No distant metastases identified. PET-CT on 28/03/24 confirms no evidence of extra-thoracic disease.

On examination today, there is significantly reduced air entry on the right with dull percussion note to mid-zone. Oxygen saturations 92% on room air. Performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 2-3.

Molecular testing has identified MTAP loss and high PD-L1 expression (TPS 80%). Given his deteriorating clinical status and molecular profile, I have recommended first-line combination immunotherapy with ipilimumab/nivolumab. We discussed the treatment schedule, potential side effects, and likely benefits in detail.

I have arranged urgent CT-guided pleural drain insertion for symptomatic management, requested baseline cardiac echo and pulmonary function tests, and booked chemotherapy unit assessment for next week. We will commence immunotherapy as soon as pleural drainage is optimized. I will review him again in one week with all results.

The case will be re-discussed at next week's mesothelioma MDT to confirm treatment approach. I have also referred to our specialist mesothelioma nurse and palliative care team for additional support.
